title: Dreams & Desires
description: Share your hopes, goals, and wishes for the future.

questions.text: What's a dream I have that I haven't told you about?
choices: A lifestyle or living situation change
A personal growth or learning goal

therapeutic.rationale: Gottman's research on 'dreams within conflict' shows that understanding your partner's hidden dreams is essential for relationship depth. Career dreams reveal ambition; travel dreams reveal adventure desires; lifestyle dreams reveal values; personal growth dreams reveal self-development wishes; relationship dreams reveal partnership hopes. Sharing hidden dreams creates deeper intimacy and allows partners to support each other's aspirations.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different hidden dreams reveal different aspirations you're each holding. This is valuable informationâ€”your partner's dreams deserve your curiosity and support even if different from yours.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared hidden dreams suggest aligned future wishes. Consider working toward this dream together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What dream have you not told your partner about? What holds you back from sharing it? What would you need from them to feel safe discussing it?

questions.text: What do I hope we experience together someday?
choices: Creating a home that feels like us
Reaching a new level of intimacy

therapeutic.rationale: Shared experience hopes reveal what adventure and partnership mean to each person. Travel hopes seek novelty together; achievement hopes seek joint accomplishment; home hopes seek belonging; intimacy hopes seek deeper connection; legacy hopes seek lasting impact. These shared aspirations become the roadmap for your future together.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different hoped-for experiences reveal different relationship dreams. Your partner may dream of travel while you dream of home. Discuss how to honor both aspirations.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared experience hopes mean you're dreaming the same dreams. Work actively toward making this vision reality.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you most hope to experience with your partner? Have you told them? What would make this dream possible?

questions.text: What's a goal I'm working toward right now?

therapeutic.rationale: Current goals reveal present priorities and need for support. Career goals need encouragement; health goals need accommodation; learning goals need time and interest; financial goals need partnership; personal development needs space and understanding. Knowing your partner's active goals helps you support them appropriately.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different current goals mean you're each pursuing different priorities. Understanding your partner's goals helps you support without competing.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared current goals create opportunity for joint pursuit and mutual support. Consider how to work toward this goal together.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What goal are you actively working toward? Does your partner know about it? How could they support you better?

questions.text: What would make me feel most fulfilled in life?

therapeutic.rationale: Fulfillment sources reveal core values and life purpose. Impact-seekers value contribution; relationship-seekers value connection; experience-seekers value richness; creation-seekers value legacy; peace-seekers value presence. Understanding what would fulfill your partner helps you support their deepest aspirations.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different fulfillment sources reveal different life values. Your partner's core need may be quite different from yours. Support what fulfills them, even if it differs from you.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared fulfillment sources suggest deep value alignment. You want the same things from life. Build a life that fulfills you both.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What would make you feel truly fulfilled? Is your current life moving toward this? What would need to change?

questions.text: How do I want you to support my dreams?
choices: Believe in me even when I doubt myself
Give me space and time to pursue them
Be interested and ask about them

therapeutic.rationale: Dream support needs vary significantly. Belief-seekers need borrowed confidence; space-needers need autonomy; practical-seekers need help; interest-seekers need curiosity; co-dreamers need participation. Knowing how your partner wants their dreams supported helps you champion them effectively.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different support needs for dreams mean your default helping may not be what your partner wants. The space-needer may feel smothered by active help; the believer-needer may feel abandoned by space-giving. Ask how to support.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared dream-support needs mean you'll naturally support each other's aspirations in the right way. You understand what helps because it's what helps you.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How do you want your partner to support your dreams? Do they know this? What would ideal support look like?
